intro: Antennaria recurva, commonly known as the bent-leaf mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves that are often curled or crinkled, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small, pink or white, and typically bloom in early summer. Antennaria recurva thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
